summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing the drafting and review of a 'Sharing Order Part II' related to the Epstein case. The correspondence focuses on ensuring the order accurately describes trust and will documents received from Epstein's estate attorneys for sharing with other parties.

events.title: Drafting of Epstein Sharing Order Part II
events.description: Email correspondence regarding the review and revision of a sharing order application to share additional trust and will documents received from Epstein's estate attorneys.

events.title: Finalization of Sharing Order
events.description: Follow-up email indicating the order will be finalized with the addition of 'revocations' and circulated.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was preparing a 'Sharing Order Part II' related to the Epstein case in January 2020.
The order pertained to sharing additional trust and will documents received from Epstein's estate attorneys over the preceding two weeks.
A key point of discussion was whether 'revocations' of documents needed to be explicitly included in the order's description of materials to be shared.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal activity and evidence sharing related to Epstein's estate following his death.
